p.a: SCES, located in Wyoming, IL, serves children from preschool through 5th grade.
SCJH located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 6th through 8th grade.
SCHS located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 9th through 12th grade.
Stark County CUSD #100 is 242 square miles
Student to teacher ratio at Stark County Elementary is 15:1

div.p: 4/15/20 – Parents – Please complete this survey for each of your students on our current eLearning effort >> SURVEY LINK
3/21/20 “All of our schools and playgrounds are closed, but personnel will be remotely checking for voicemails if you need to reach staff.”
For technical issues with student Chromebooks, contact Mr. Heinold at IT@stark100.com

p.a: 3/13/20 Letter to students, staff, and community.

h3.span: Our architect recently presented the School Board with three design proposals to upgrade the Toulon campus. Click this link to see the designs. Master Plan for Toulon Campus

div.p: Our district is made up of 727 attending three schools Stark County Elementary, Stark County Junior High and Stark County High School.

div.class: cff-item cff-photo-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

span.span:
"Lights for the Fight" - Honoring the class of 2020
Tonight Stark County took part in the statewide display, turning on athletic field lights for 20 minutes to honor this year's senior class and the athletes whose seasons were cancelled due to the current pandemic. Wyoming-Speer Fire Department, Toulon Fire Department, Stark County Ambulance, and Wyoming Police Department also came out to help add to the display.

div.p: Cool—did you use someone‘s drone to get the pic?

div.class: cff-item cff-video-post cff-embedded-video cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span: Please enjoy Mrs. Kelly's Daily Read Aloud!

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span: Tonight from 8:00 to 8:20pm, the lights at Gary Johnson field will be on in an effort to celebrate 20 minutes for the Class of 2020! We are joining many communities in the salute and we invite everyone to turn on any lights at their home to join us.

div.class: cff-item cff-video-post cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span: Stop what you're doing and watch this video about Coping Skills from our special education team! I promise it'll be worth your time. Please excuse the water mark over Miss Boswell's face.

div.p: You three are so cute!! Kelly I am glad you got Kevin in the video!
Megan Militello Alexa Kate Stanley can we please do something like this!? 🤣
You are ALL priceless gems. We are so fortunate to be part of your team!
Oh my gosh! I cried! This is so, so cute you guys! You three are the best!!
That was great ladies!😂Keep up the good work!❤
This right here...you three are doing amazing work! I smiled & smiled and right now that feels like a pretty great coping skill!

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span:
Attn: SCHS JUNIORS: From Mrs. McGrath
As you all are aware, we will not be in school on the scheduled day for the SAT. As of now the summer test dates are also cancelled.
So what does this mean to you as you gear up to apply to college in the early fall? First of all, you are not alone in the problem. This is a nationwide concern for all juniors. The College Board, the one that is in charge of the SAT, sent out an email yesterday late afternoon stating that they hope to resume testing in August and will make sure to have enough dates for everyone to test. The school test date (which is free to students) as of now, will be rescheduled for early fall. The colleges are sending out emails over the last few weeks stating they were going "test optional". That means that the ACT/SAT is not a factor for admissions to the college. Many schools were already leaning that way and giving prospective students the opportunity to write personal essays discussing their academic strengths and weaknesses instead of having a test score define their academic history.
Mrs. McGrath will continue to provide you with information regarding this once final decisions are made regarding testing and closures.

p.span:
Virtual Rebel Rally!!! We Got This Stark County!
We showcase the Students of the Month, performances from our music department, art department, as well as updates about sports teams and activities. Sprinkled throughout this video is "Can you guess the staff member by their Senior picture?".
Enjoy!!

div.p: What a great idea! We WILL get through this! #RollSC
Way to go Abby! Carla Dunbar
Thanks for still recognizing all these kids' hard work!
Here is an unlisted youtube link to this video - youtu.be/Sob-5rPfdp8
Great Job putting it together Mr. Utsinger!
So much fun! Way to go, SC!
Congratulations Haven Quanstrom on student of the month!!!!!!
This was fun to watch! Way to go Mr. Utsinger!! We will get thru this SC!!
